business.headline: Vande Bharat Sleeper train is welcome, but let's have more Amrit Bharats Expresses, tooAs Vande Bharat trains redefine speed and comfort, the troubling question persists whether India's rail modernisation truly serves the majority who still travel daily in overcrowded general coaches without dignity.

From late fees and interest to delayed refunds and lost tax benefits, missing the ITR deadline makes compliance more expensive and restrictive for taxpayers.

Sensex down nearly 3,000 points in 6 days: What's really driving the sell-offThe past six days have been a reminder that markets do not move in straight lines. When uncertainty rises and confidence weakens, even strong long-term stories can go through uncomfortable phases.

How employers can address New labour code's take-home salary and build employee trustFor employers, the reform means more disciplined salary design and tighter governance. Compensation structures that previously leaned heavily on allowances now require rebalancing. Finance leaders will need to review salary templates, update payroll logic, and ensure CTCs align with the wage definition.

Sensex tumbles over 600 points: 3 reasons why the stock market is fallingAt around 11:48 am, the Sensex was trading at 82,937.81, down 638.43 points, while the Nifty stood at 25,494.30, lower by 189 points.

Gold, silver prices at record levels: What should investors expect next?With prices at record highs, the real question for investors is not what gold and silver have done, but whether this rally is merely pausing or setting up for another leg higher.

Explained: Why HDFC Bank shares remain under selling pressureAs of 10:24 am, shares of the private lender were trading at Rs 932.80, down Rs 6.20, or 0.66 per cent, adding to losses seen over recent sessions.

entertainment.headline: Zayn Malik finally hints at a world tour, but will India make the cut? Pop star Zayn Malik has teased his inaugural world tour for 2026, sharing preliminary venues but omitting India and Asia from the initial list. This move follows his upcoming Las Vegas residency and recent musical collaborations.

Hema Malini says Sunny Deol tells him whatever he does, shuts down rumours of rift Hema Malini shuts down the rumours of a rift between her and Dharmendra's sons, Sunny and Bobby Deol. In an interview, she talks about the interpersonal dynamics in the family and how Sunny is planning to take Dharmendra's legacy ahead.

Aamir Khan bursts into laughter as he watches Sunil Grover mimic him during shoot A behind-the-scenes moment from the promotional shoot of Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos captures Aamir Khan's enthusiastic reaction as Sunil Grover impersonates him, highlighting mutual respect and the lighthearted atmosphere on set.

Meet Marty Reisman, the man who inspired Timothy Chalamet's Marty Supreme Timothee Chalamet's character in Marty Supreme is inspired by table tennis legend named Marty Reisman, who was also a hustler who treated the game like prizefighting activity.

Priyanka Chopra's viral parenting tip is a Golden Globes winner! Nick Jonas agrees At the Golden Globe Awards 2026, Priyanka Chopra Jonas and Nick Jonas discussed their approach to balancing careers and parenting. Alongside Nick Jonas, her answer has found relatability among fans online.

Taapsee Pannu on new-age Bollywood publicity tactics, slams aggressive PR culture Taapsee Pannu has spoken out about Bollywood's increasingly aggressive PR culture, saying promotion today often involves pulling others down rather than just pushing oneself forward.

Allu Arjun heads to Japan with his family ahead of Pushpa 2 release. Watch Allu Arjun, accompanied by his family, arrived in Tokyo to promote Pushpa 2: The Rule, as the film prepares for its release in Japan on January 16.

Pro-DMK, anti-Hindu film: Tamil Nadu Youth Congress demands ban on Parasakthi The Tamil Nadu Youth Congress has called for a ban on actor Sivakarthikeyan's film Parasakthi, claiming that it distorts facts related to the party and called the movie a "pro-DMK and anti-Hindu".

Parasakthi box office Day 3: Monday blues for Sivakarthikeyan's political drama After a promising opening weekend, the Tamil political drama Parasakthi experienced a significant decline in box office collections on its first Monday. The film has by far earned Rs 48 crore globally.

Mallika Prasad, who plays the child trafficker villain in Rani Mukerji's Mardaani 3 The Mardaani 3 trailer has sparked major buzz with Mallika Prasad's chilling turn as Amma, a rare female antagonist who has left audiences intrigued and unsettled. Her menacing presence has driven curiosity around her career, adding to the anticipation for Rani Mukerji's return as Shivani Shivaji Roy.

The Raja Saab box office Day 4: Prabhas' film slips, sees sharp drop in India The box office performance of Prabhas' latest horror-comedy, The Raja Saab, declined sharply on its fourth day, with a 71 per cent drop in earnings compared to Sunday. The film continues to draw mixed occupancy rates across various regions and languages.

Yash's Toxic under fire over 'obscene' teaser, Karnataka women's board alerts CBFC The Aam Aadmi Party's women's wing in Karnataka has filed a complaint with the state women's commission, objecting to scenes in the teaser of Yash's upcoming film Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown Ups, and called for its removal from public platforms.

How Dhurandhar 2-Toxic collision will spark an epic battle of machismo 'Dhurandhar 2' vs 'Toxic', two action giants. two radically different brands of machismo. And one explosive March collision the box office isn't ready for.

Emraan Hashmi defends hypermasculine films, calls for more women-centric stories Emraan Hashmi has shared a take on the success of hypermasculine films like Animal, saying audience identification often outweighs online backlash.

The Raja Saab: Is Prabhas' film a case of taking the Telugu audience for granted? Prabhas' starrer The Raja Saab directed by Maruthi brings an uncomfortable conversation about audience trust in Telugu cinema.

Deepika Padukone is all smiles as bridesmaid at her best friend's NYC wedding Deepika Padukone's presence at her friend Sneha Ramchander's wedding in New York, accompanied by Ranveer Singh, drew attention online as new photos from the ceremony circulated.

Amid Haq praise, Yami Gautam recalls being unwelcomed in Bollywood in old interview As Haq earns widespread acclaim, a throwback interview of Yami Gautam has resurfaced in which she spoke about feeling unwelcomed in Bollywood. The actor also credited her family and husband Aditya Dhar for standing by her through the most difficult phases of her journey.

Vir Das reacts to fan comment on his home after Farah Khan vlog: Made my lady happy Vir Das melted hearts after sharing a fan's comment praising the simplicity of his home following Farah Khan's visit for her vlog. Calling the moment special, the comedian said the appreciation made his wife Shivani very happy as they prefer a simple, unfancy life.

We're still together: Blake Shelton addresses divorce rumours with Gwen Stefani Blake Shelton has shut down ongoing rumours about trouble in his marriage with Gwen Stefani, calling out the repetitive cycle of online gossip and misleading images.

general news.headline: Congress slams BJP over China meet as Beijing stakes claim to J&K's Shaksgam ValleyA fresh political controversy has erupted as Congress accuses the BJP of sending mixed signals to China amid reports of Chinese construction in Jammu and Kashmir's Shaksgam Valley. The BJP defends its engagement with the Chinese Communist Party as part of inter-party dialogue despite rising border tensions.

Live: Keep them to your house, bench pulls up dog feedersSupreme Court Stray Dogs Hearing Live Updates: A bench of Supreme Court Justices comprising Vikram Nath, Sandeep Mehta and NV Anjaria is continuing to hear the case of street dogs in India today. In the last hearing on January 8, the bench highlighted the lack of proper implementation of ABC rules while also schooling dog lovers, including the counsel of actor Sharmila Tagore, who is one of the petitioners, of being "far from reality". The top court observed that dogs can smell fear in humans before attacking, a quote that quickly went viral. It also clarified that it has not directed the removal of all street dogs, but their treatment instead as per the ABC rules. Senior advocate Abhishek Manu Singhvi, one of the lawyers representing animal activists and dog lovers, urged the Supreme Court to involve domain experts while dealing with the case. Meanwhile, the bench refused to entertain cases of women dog feeders being harassed, asking them to file FIRs instead, while stressing that the court order was not a licence for harassment against anyone. The Supreme Court on November 7, 2025, directed the capture, sterilisation and permanent removal of all street dogs from educational institutions, hospitals, sports facilities, railway and bus stations. It had also directed the removal of stray cattle from these regions and highways. Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

Trump slaps 25% tariffs on Iran trade partners. Is India the real target?From Ukraine to Iran, every global crisis seems to come with consequences for India. On Tuesday, Trump's decision to impose a 25% tariff on Iran's trade partners has again placed India in US's line of fire.

Did US use sonic weapon in Venezuela op? Whistleblower lawyer's take on viral claimA Venezuelan security guard narrated that during the US's operation in the Caribbean nation to capture Nicolas Maduro and his wife, they were attacked by "intense sound wave" that caused their noses to bleed and be unable to stand.

What happens to 16 satellites PSLV lost in space? Ex-Isro engineer explainsTrouble struck near the end of the third stage, a solid-fuel motor that provides the final big push toward orbit. ISRO reported a sudden disturbance.

This comes in the backdrop of several bus fire incidents across the country that have raised concerns over passenger safety and compliance with safety norms.

Tumbling currency or regime change: What triggered Iran's deadly protestsThe rial's collapse poses an existential crisis for Iran's government as hundreds die in crackdowns.

Live: US fighter jets at Qatar base after warning Americans to leave Iran amid protestsIran Protest News Live Updates: Iran is facing one of its gravest crises since 1979 as nationwide protests intensify, with rights groups reporting nearly 600 deaths and more than 10,000 arrests amid an internet blackout. Opposition figures, including Reza Pahlavi, have urged US President Donald Trump to actively support protesters, while rallies in London and Los Angeles echoed calls for regime change. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy framed the unrest as a strategic blow to Russia. Tehran denies protester tolls, blames foreign-backed "terrorists", signals readiness for talks with Washington, and has staged pro-government rallies as security forces tighten control. Stay with IndiaToday.in for the latest and live updates.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 13 | Thirupparamkundram: Rise of the Sacred Sthala TraditionThirupparamkundram, very much in the news these days, is where it all began, literally and metaphorically: Bhakti got localised with sacred sites and attendant pilgrimages. And this is now a legal and political journey too.

Canada arrests man for country's biggest gold heist, key suspect in IndiaA man has been arrested at Toronto airport in connection with Canada's largest gold theft, valued over 20 million Canadian dollars. Police are also searching for an Indian-origin former Air Canada employee, who is believed to be in India.

Iran to hang 26-year-old in first reported execution over anti-Khamenei protestsA 26-year-old protester, Erfan Soltani, arrested last week, is now facing an imminent death sentence. Activists and rights groups are warning that his case could set a precedent for executions aimed at deterring further anti-regime protests.

Are You Dead? This iPhone app alerts loved ones if users stop checking inA new app is topping the charts in China, named "Are you dead?" The app will notify your loved ones if you stop checking in for two days, alerting them that you may be in trouble.

King Trump proves India's choice of Westminster system rightNow and then, there are calls to replace India's parliamentary system with a US-style presidency. But Donald Trump's tenure shows how fragile American checks and balances can be.

The elite ice warriors that are waiting for US forces in GreenlandUS President Donald Trump mocked Denmark's defence of Greenland as "two dogs and a sledge", but reports suggest that SAS-style Arctic forces could be ready to confront American forces in a region where temperatures can dip as low as -50 degrees Celsius.

Delhi records season's coldest at 3°C as Gurugram slips below zero for 2nd dayDelhi and large parts of north India experienced the coldest morning of the season, with temperatures plunging to near-freezing levels and weather agencies issuing high-level alerts. The severe cold wave, accompanied by dense fog and frost, has disrupted daily life and raised concerns over crop damage.

Germany announces visa-free transit for Indian passport holdersThe visa-free transit facility means that Indian travellers passing through German airports en route to another country will no longer need to apply for a separate transit visa.

Kohli's young doppleganger recalls being called 'chhota cheeku' by India starVirat Kohli affectionately nicknamed his viral young fan 'chhota cheeku' ahead of the first ODI against New Zealand in Vadodara. The child went viral for having uncanny resemblance to Kohli's childhood photographs.

Apple, Google strike Gemini deal to power revamped SiriThe deal announced Monday marks a major vote of confidence for Google. Its technology already drives much of Samsung's "Galaxy AI," but the Siri deal unlocks a large market with Apple's installed base of more than two billion active devices.

sports.headline: Shreyas Iyer on verge of surpassing Virat Kohli, Shikhar Dhawan's major record Shreyas Iyer is on the verge of leaving behind Shikhar Dhawan and Virat Kohli to become the fastest Indian to 3,000 runs in ODIs. The star batter is just 34 runs away from achieving the milestone.

FC Barcelona announce Joao Cancelo return on loan deal from Al Hilal FC Barcelona have reinforced their backline by re-signing Joao Cancelo on loan from Al Hilal. The move comes a day after Barca lifted their first trophy of the season by beating Real Madrid.

Asif Nazrul: 'Impossible For Bangladesh To Play In India', Cites 'Anti-Bangladesh Campaign' Bangladesh's Youth and Sports Adviser, Asif Nazrul, has stated that India is unsafe for his country's cricketers, creating uncertainty around Bangladesh's participation in the upcoming T20 World Cup matches hosted in India. Nazrul claims 'it is impossible for Bangladesh to play in India' due to an ongoing 'anti-Bangladesh campaign' and a lack of security. He is demanding a neutral venue, such as Sri Lanka, for his team's matches. The adviser also questioned the neutrality of the International Cricket Council (ICC), suggesting it may be influenced by India. The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has indicated it is awaiting a final decision from the ICC on the matter, with a travel deadline for the team approaching on January 26.

Virat Kohli's brother takes cryptic dig on Sanjay Manjrekar for easy ODIs comment IND vs NZ: Virat Kohli's Vadodara masterclass reignited the ODI difficulty debate. His brother Vikas Kohli took a subtle dig at Sanjay Manjrekar after the former India batter's easy format remarks resurfaced online.

Kohli's young doppleganger recalls being called 'chhota cheeku' by India star Virat Kohli affectionately nicknamed his viral young fan 'chhota cheeku' ahead of the first ODI against New Zealand in Vadodara. The child went viral for having uncanny resemblance to Kohli's childhood photographs.

Gautam Gambhir biased? Did Ayush Badoni deserve India ODI call-up Ayush Badoni earned his maiden call-up to Team India for the remaining ODIs against New Zealand. The selection has sparked criticism of head coach Gautam Gambhir, with accusations of favouritism from fans.

Wayne Rooney eyeing Manchester United return with Michael Carrick coaching link Wayne Rooney has opened the door to a Manchester United return as a coach. The club legend said joining Michael Carrick's interim setup would be a "no-brainer" if offered the opportunity.

Khel Ratna or not, Hardik Singh has eyes firmly on World Cup–Asian Games double With the World Cup and Asian Games on his mind, Hardik Singh wants to achieve the double and stand on the top step of the podium at both events this year. In an exclusive chat with India Today, the Indian vice-captain talks about playing for HIL GC, 2026 goals and more.

Lakshya Sen vs Ayush Shetty to kick off blockbuster badminton week in Delhi India Open 2026: Former champions lead India's charge as Lakshya Sen faces Ayush Shetty in a blockbuster opener, while teenage debutant Tanvi Sharma steps into the spotlight in New Delhi.

After WPL snub, Australia captain Alyssa Healy announces shock retirement from cricketAustralia captain Alyssa Healy has announced her retirement ahead of the India series. The decision follows weeks of reflection and comes weeks after the veteran wicketkeeper-batter went unsold at the WPL auction.

Virat Kohli century or no food for a week: Kaif amazed by fan's faith in India starMohammed Kaif highlighted Virat Kohli's unmatched aura after a fan vowed to go hungry without a century. Kohli then fell just short of a hundred while guiding India's chase against New Zealand in Vadodara.

Kylian Mbappe pens special farewell message for Xabi Alonso after Real Madrid exitKylian Mbappe paid an emotional tribute to Xabi Alonso after Real Madrid confirmed the manager's sudden exit. Alonso's short Bernabeu stint ended following the Spanish Super Cup defeat to Barcelona.

Real Madrid part ways with Xabi Alonso after Spanish Super Cup final lossSpanish giants Real Madrid have decided to part ways with manager Xabi Alonso by mutual agreement. The club announced its decision just a day after Madrid's Spanish Super Cup loss against bitter rivals Barcelona.

WPL 2026: Warriorz meltdown in front Grace Harris blitz, RCB make it two in twoGrace Harris' blitz and disciplined bowling effort ensured that RCB made it two in two in the WPL 2026 as they crushed a hapless UP Warriorz side on Monday, January 12.

Bangladesh willing to play T20 World Cup in Pakistan: Bangladesh Sports advisorBangladesh sports advisor Asif Nazrul has stressed that it is impossible for their national cricket team to play T20 World Cup matches in India. Nazrul has stated that India he will not send the team to play matches in a country that has anti-Bangladesh sentiment.

Bangladesh backtracks hours after anti-India statement, await ICC responseT20 World Cup: Bangladesh backtracked hours after making a provocative anti-India statement on January 12. After the country's sports advisor claimed that the ICC had acknowledged the team's security concerns, the Bangladesh Cricket Board said in an official statement that it is still awaiting a formal response from the world body.

ICC rejects claim it validated Bangladesh's security concerns in India: SourcesThe ICC has rejected claims that it has validated Bangladesh's security concerns in India, sources told India Today on Monday, January 12.

Devdutt Padikkal scripts history as Karnataka beat Mumbai to reach semifinalDevdutt Padikkal created history by becoming the first batter to score 700 runs in multiple Vijay Hazare Trophy seasons as Karnataka knocked out Mumbai via the VJD method to reach the semifinals.

RCB vs UP Warriorz Highlights: Harris blitz helps Bengaluru thrash WarriorzRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) vs UP Warriorz (UPW) WPL Highlights: A brilliant innings from Grace Harris sees RCB in cruise control of this chase as UP Warriorz struggle to stem the run flow in Navi Mumbai.

North England turns orange! Kavya Maran's Sunrisers Leeds unveil logoSunrisers Leeds have officially unveiled their new logo after the acquisition of Northern Superchargers was completed. Headingley will be used as the home ground for Sunrisers Leeds in the upcoming season.

KC Cariappa, former IPL spinner, announces retirement from Indian cricketKC Cariappa, known for his mystery spin and stints with multiple IPL franchises, has announced his retirement from Indian cricket. Shikhar Dhawan announces engagement to girlfriend Sophie Shine in heartfelt Insta postShikhar Dhawan has announced his engagement to girlfriend Sophie Shine with a heartwarming Instagram post on Monday, January 12.

ICC dominated by Indians, no point in its existence: Ex-Pakistan spinnerFormer Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal has lambasted the International Cricket Council. In a provocative statement, Ajmal has said that the ICC is dominated by Indians and there is no point in its existence.

Embarrassment for Mohammad Rizwan, Pakistan batter gets retired out in BBLMohammad Rizwan's BBL journey endured a new low as he was retired out during the clash between Melbourne Renegades and Sydney Thunder on Monday, January 12. Rizwan was taken off from batting as Will Sutherland came in as his replacement.

Mohammad Nabi snaps at Bangladesh reporter over questions on Mustafizur IPL rowVeteran Afghanistan all-rounder Mohammad Nabi lost his cool at a Bangladesh reporter after being asked an unwarranted question about the IPL controversy involving Mustafizur Rahman and Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR).

Watch: Lamine Yamal leaks another Szczesny smoking clip after Super Cup winLamine Yamal accidentally went live from Barcelona's dressing room and briefly caught Wojciech Szczesny smoking after the Super Cup final win over Real Madrid. The clip was quickly cut but spread rapidly online.

WPL games to have no spectators during Navi Mumbai municipal elections: ReportTwo Women's Premier League matches will be held without spectators this week due to the Navi Mumbai municipal corporation elections on January 15. The decision follows concerns over security as police resources are diverted for election duties, and ticket sales haven't gone live for matches on January 14, 15, and 16.

Virat Kohli walks the talk: Shreyas Iyer praises India icon's consistencyIND vs NZ: Shreyas Iyer praised Virat Kohli's consistency after the latter's composed 93 guided India to a four-wicket win over New Zealand. Kohli also crossed 28,000 international runs and climbed to second on the all-time list.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
